website_summaries.verdict: A good standard keyboard that is affordable and comfortable to use.
pros: Features an ergonomic design and a cushioned palm rest
Battery can last up to 3 years depending on use
cons: Space bar positioning is a little hard to get used to
Will not last as long under heavy use

website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive product that guarantees quality. If you are looking for a curved keyboard, this is a strong contender.
cons: Keys require slightly more force to be pressed than other keyboards, but it's clear that this is a minor issue

customer_reviews.title: keboard that doesn't tpe the entire alphabet
customer_reviews.text: Severa of the kes stick. In fact, I am writing this and leaving the typos that the keyboard makes to demonstrate the level of frustration this causes. Specificall the "Y" button doesn't work unless ou hit it several times. The "L" button is off too. Here is the alphabet as this keboard thinks it should go: abcdefghijkmnopqstuvwxz
customer_reviews.author: AmyMarieS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible lag and connection constantly drops
customer_reviews.text: I tried this model of a Logitch keyboard hoping it did not suffer the key sticking the other more expensive model developed after a few months. This keyboard has terrible lag and the wireless connection drops out constantly which wastes a lot of time. I liked the layout but wished it had back lighting. The connection and lag issues render it basically unusable. This is the last Logitech keyboard I will be buying. I have used their products for decades but no longer will buy their keyboards. 3 bad experiences not caused by abuse or spills is enough. I wish I could give it zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: gcase

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After seeing the reviews most of them we about how the letters fade so quickly. What I did was using clear hard as nails nail polish and painted over all the letters and the other keys. I hope this prevent s the fading.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Age Well (i.e., Zoom Meetings)
customer_reviews.text: Decent keyboard (a bit bulky), functional, but doesn't age well. Now that everyone is "Sheltering in Place," 100% of our meetings are via Zoom. If I ever forget to mute my mic, the clickity-clackety keys are so loud it interrupts the meeting (my face now the active speaker), while everyone yells in unison: "Can you mute your mic!" Extremely embarrassing & forced me to find something much quieter. Fortunately, I found another Logitech (Logitech Ergo K860 Wireless Ergonomic Keyboard), which has worked out PERFECTLY. As a test, I intentionally kept my mic on & typed away (ZERO complaints). Even when I forget to mute, I've yet to have anyone complain...
customer_reviews.author: Kaladin Stormblessed

customer_reviews.title: Keys losing paint after less than one month of use.  Otherwise I would have liked it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the product since mid may. It works great and I love it except that the S key and a little on the D key is already starting to rub off. I haven't even had this a month. Update: They replaced with a second keyboard. Same thing happened after 30 days. Logitech doesn't want the unit back to find out what the problem is. They just keep sending me new ones. This time, a different model that is just not as comfortable to use. The first pic is the first keyboard. Second pic is my second keybaord. Second was used longer - about 4 months until I replaced it. It started fading though after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Number key pad quit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this in advance as the exact one that I used for several years with heavy usage was just getting old and not working well. I did not install this until a few weeks after the 90 warranty. In today's world of diminishing quality and reliability, one should wait for a product to fail before ordering a replacement, sit and wait for it to be delivered. I have used Logitech products for years and always pleased with them. Thanks once again to manufactures selling us Chinese junk! Logitech needs to step up to the plate and back their products beyond a reasonable time frame of 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard but here is the rub. If your CPU gets busy then it does not update the USB port as fast and it is like your PC is slow or locked. Eventually it comes around and listens to the port and updates the screen but as a programmer it is not as good as I had hoped. I also got a wireless mouse to go with it and had the same issue. So if you are just typing letters etc or doing mild PC work this is a great keyboard but if you multitask or have PC intensive apps then I would stick with a wired keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Stan from Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Right up front there are no lights to indicate when the Caps Lock or the Number lock is on. That by it's self is a deal breaker with me because I have clumsy fingers and need to know that, especially when typing in passwords. Who ever thought that this is an ergonomic design should get a pair of human hands to use for comparison. The keys are no where near the angle that hands naturally rest at. And what is this up and down positioning of the keys supposed to be for? The height difference isn't much unless it was supposed to be annoying, in which case it is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard has not reliability and the 8 key stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these keyboards, one for my home office and the other at work. It seems after one month of use, the 8 key on the number side of the keyboard will not work. Since this has happened on two seperately purchased keyboard, obviously the keyboard is a piece of junk. My recomendation is do not buy and because of this, I will never ever own another logitach keyboard. Good luck if you ignore the warning. I can only post my empirical observation from personal knowledge. Thank you for wasting my time and money Logitech. Cheap stuff, obviously.
customer_reviews.author: NJreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Parrot Proof
customer_reviews.text: My best friend who is a professional writer recommended this keyboard to me. When my parrot finished off my old keyboard cable, I decided the only defense was to get rid of the cable, which I've already done for my mouse. I have used Logitech wireless products for many years with great success, so I took the dive on the K350 keyboard. It looks weird. When I took it out of the box, I was leary. But the very first time I sat down to type on it, it felt like the most logical tool on the planet. I love this keyboard and I won't go back! Take THAT, Alex! No more cables for you to chew on!
customer_reviews.author: Teri  Hogan

customer_reviews.title: 5 months later and I can't pair to any devices
customer_reviews.text: I did like this keyboard, however it just died on me after only 5 months of use. I have three unify receivers and two computers and this device wont respond to any of them. I keep seeing this error: 08:17:49:0416]: ----------[04-29-2020]------------------------- Unifying API ------------------------------------ [08:17:49:0416]: <8476>Unifying Loaded DLL: 2.50.25 [08:17:53:0110]: <15944>HID++ contention false positive error detected (Idx:0xFF. Threshold:1.0 ms). [08:19:00:0939]: <12168> Device doesn't respond!! Current retry count: 0 [08:19:20:0515]: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [08:56:58:0489]: ----------[04-29-2020]------------------------- Unifying API ------------------------------------ [08:56:58:0489]: <5288>Unifying Loaded DLL: 2.50.25 [08:58:58:0790]: <12356>HID++ contention false positive error detected (Idx:0xFF. Threshold:1.0 ms). [08:59:30:0952]: <12356>HID++ contention false positive error detected (Idx:0xFF. Threshold:0.9 ms). [09:01:33:0968]: <12356>HID++ contention false positive error detected (Idx:0xFF. Threshold:0.8 ms). Log content displays the 100% of the available one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent connection, lagging
customer_reviews.text: I liked the feel of the keyboard but I experienced a lot of lag and poor connection with the keyboard that basically made it unusable. The USB dongle was in a laptop docking station less than a foot away on my desk. It didn't matter when I moved the dongle to the front of the station (no physical interference between the dongle and keyboard). Not sure if it was defective or just an unreliable keyboard, but I returned it. I used my other wireless Logitech keyboard for many years before it failed, so I'm disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Allegra

customer_reviews.title: Not a true ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: While I can see that some people like this as an introduction to an ergonomic keyboard as it's easier to adapt your typing coming from a traditional keyboard, in my opinion, what's the point if the purpose is to have the best ergonomics? I think a split board is required so that your arms can be in a more neutral position. This board has neither a split layout nor a sloped center so it really is more close to a traditional keyboard. I bought the Kensington Pro wireless keyboard (connects either USB dongle or bluetooth) and prefer it's lower travel more laptop-like keys. The keys on this logitech are so loud and it's just really huge. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: ka514

customer_reviews.title: Great at first...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at home. I liked the shape and the ergonomics of it, and I've had great luck with Logitech keyboards in the past. However, after about 6 months of use, the letters on some of the keys are coming off. As of now, specifically the A, S, N and the L. I've never had that happen before. There are also times when the keyboard just stops working. I have to unplug the USB dongle and plug it back in to get it to work again. Never had that problem with these keyboards before, either. I like how it works when it's working, and I really wish the labels on the keys held up better.
customer_reviews.author: 2KCJ

customer_reviews.title: Super loud keys
customer_reviews.text: There is so much to like about this keyboard, but it is LOUD. I work in a fairly quiet office, but normal typing isn't generally an issue. I annoyed myself with this after just a few minutes of using it and had to swap back my my old one. It's not quite as loud as a mechanical keyboard but it's super close, and without the awesome feel you get with a mechanical. I'm super bummed, I was hoping this one would work. Everything else seems to be fine, but unless you don't mind people complaining about your typing or are using it alone and don't mind the noise, I'd skip this.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Lehne

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to return it but unfortunately I threw the packing away. Pros: 1. Somwaht ergonomic. 2. Wrist rest is good. Cons: 1. Keys are stiff. 2. Distance between keys are wider. Hard to press Ctrl+v which is an important combination to me. Plus the stiff keys, my pinky finger is tired after one day's work. 3. Meaningless key rearrangement. It divides F keys into 3 per group, instead of 4 like regular keyboards. Home, End, and Insert keys are all not in their typical location.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Major improvement to my home office
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this keyboard makes. I've even noticed my trapezoids muscles aren't as tense. I use this for work and my entire day revolves around typing so my only gripe is there is no caps lock indicator on the keyboard, turns out you have to download a program to display the indicator on the screen. I downloaded it and the screen indicator is functional. I'm not savvy enough to link my micro usb reciver to my off brand wireless mouse, but I would suggest if you do not have a wireless mouse, buy the combo so you only use one USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Marie D. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if  yyouu'rre working on aa ddisseratiion
customer_reviews.text: See what happened? While typing that headline, this keyboard suddenly had another episode where it is sluggish making it difficult to type. It stutters, delays and repeats characters. There is no rhyme or reason...and always when I'm on deadline with a dissertation chapter. I bought it in Oct 2017 and it began stuttering within weeks. In hindsight, I should have returned it asap but I thought it was a battery issue. Changed batteries...happened again. On-off, on-off, on-off....happened again. Updated drivers...happened again. According to the Logitech and other help sites, it's called mechanical chatter which is tech speak for this keyboard is an unreliable piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the design, hate that you can't find a good wired keyboard anymore
customer_reviews.text: I hate the delay that the BlueTooth devices have. I miss being able to find good designs that are wired. THat being said, this is the most comfortable design I have found yet in a keyboard. For someone who never had a 'keyboarding' or 'typing' class, and leaned to type by working, this design is great. I used to love the 'split' style, but I found that, for me anyway, it was limiting not having been "trained" to have my hands/fingers in certain places on the keyboard. This wave design negates that is is far easier to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: The title shouldn't thwart you from buying this keyboard. It's good for the price. It's ergonomic, wireless, and has all the multi-media buttons you could ever need plus a separate number pad. However, the location of the volume toggles are such that I hit the space bar with the bottom of my palm when I'm changing the volume. Kind of annoying, but it's a minor problem. Further, the action on the volume buttons could be a little more crisp in my opinion, along with the backspace button. I do some casual gaming on it as well, and it does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price, but....
customer_reviews.text: A very nice keyboard for the price. Wireless works fine and is comfortable to use. Some nice features built in, such as shortcut keys for several different things. However, the lettering on the keys is a little less than ideal, as two letters are now invisible after 2 years. The big issue I have is trying to contact Logitech support for warranty. Just now, I went through describing my issue online and every time I was told to login in (again) and the website redirected me to a blank page. I will attempt to try once again in a couple days, but for a company like this, it should be flawless.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: Good, but letters wear off the keys
customer_reviews.text: The features available on the keyboard is impressive (a number of keys activate things like music, volume, calculator, camera, zoom, etc.). So, functionally this keyboard works well. And it's ergonomic - even if it doesn't feel "solid." (I miss the old IBM keyboards). I type A LOT. But after a year, the lettering on several of the most-used keys wore off. Really, Logitech??! I've been through several of these keyboards, and others by Logitech. Same issue on each of them. I'm now using a K850 without all the media buttons. The letters haven't rubbed off yet, but it's only been four months. I'm sure they will: it's obviously a "feature." ;-)
customer_reviews.author: W. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Nice large keybaord. Good ergonomics. Lots of extras. Noisy as hell.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is known for producing quality products. My IT dept recommended this brand for a wireless keyboard, and I still have a computer speaker and sub-woofer set that I won in a raffle 15 years ago that I still use, so it's a solid brand. This keyboard, while chocked full of cool features, does require you to re-learn how to type on it. My biggest issue is that the keys are very much lightweight plastics and super-noisy. Clackety-clack!!! Try not to type while on an open mic conference call or on the phone. Maybe opt for a hybrid/mechanical. My next one when this thing breaks will be a higher end gaming keyboard to tackle all my work needs.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Klunky but best replacement for MS Comfort Curve 2000
customer_reviews.text: I *loved* my MS Comfort Curve 2000. It's out of production, and this keyboard is the best replacement I could find. I have somewhat unique requirements that only this keyboard meets: * No gaps between left & right halves of keyboard * No big raised hump in center * Regular sized Esc key * Full set and standard layout of the "extra" keys set between main and numeric sections (K350 is close) Overall I'm happy, but the feel is somewhat "clunky". The key travel feels a little cheap, slightly noisy, some side-to-side motion, and can require a heavy hand, especially if you don't press directly straight down.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I just received this keyboard but already love it. My last keyboard, that came with my computer, didn't mark the home keys very well so I was always started in the wrong place. On this keyboard the home keys are marked well so I go right there when I start typing. It was extremely easy to set up. You just plug in the wireless usb and pull the tab to connect the batteries that come with it. It is also very comfortable on my wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sooo small
customer_reviews.text: My previous 2013 wired Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 for Business is so much bigger. The overall length is about the same, but the keys are on this new Logitech are SOOO much smaller. I'm 6'4" and 280lbs. Using this keyboard is much like an Orangutan trying to open an Tic-tac box for a breath mint. Very difficult to use with "longer fingers" and "thicker" bones. I have to "tip-toe", with my fingers to hit the right keys. The overall setup is nice and easy, but due to its lack of key size, I will be handing this keyboard off to my 12 year-old and my wife for further use. I plugged my 2013 ergo back in.
customer_reviews.author: Construction me

customer_reviews.title: no response if >1 m away from receiver.
customer_reviews.text: We need a wireless keyboard in the living room. The PC is located by the TV and the keyboard has to be on the coffee table (front of the sofa) so my families can use it easily. Our old one, cost 30 dollars and had been working good, stopped working last week so we need a replacement. With this new keyboard, I found it has to be very close to the receiver in order to work, like within 1 m. Our coffee table is like 2~3 meters away from our PC and this keyboard hardly can send any signals back to my PC. I cannot believe such a high rated product would disappoint me like this. Will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lifan

customer_reviews.title: Weird Delete key, otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the K350 for two weeks now. It was easy to install using my existing trackball unify dongle, once I figured out that I needed to download additional software. I don't care about the programmable keys, so no comments there. It's a decent keyboard for programming with the exception of the GIGANTIC delete key that is different from every keyboard I have ever used, and even after two weeks has me accidentally deleting all the time. I don't know how long it will take to retrain my hand after 30+ years of a normal key placement to this weird configuration. Otherwise, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smart

customer_reviews.title: Delays & dropouts at random!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been driving me up the wall. I thought it was a problem with my new computer but i saw at least a few other reviews on here describing the same thing. Blehck. I like the layout and the whole unifying receiver thing that i've been using with Logitech mouse products, but the keyboard is just not getting it done!!!! Sometimes i have to hit a key 10 times before it registers on the screen! Not fun! Frustrating! I've put up with it for 6 months and it's time to move on. I'm very disappointed in a brand that i've come to rely on. And oh yeah, the keys are kinda loud.
customer_reviews.author: MDamian

customer_reviews.title: Slides everywhere
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is fine. But I just cannot deal with this thing anymore. It slides across the desk from just the light pressure of your palms resting on the keyboard. I find myself 30-40 times a day just pulling it back across the desk. If I could return it at this point I would, I'm ready to just throw the thing out the window. My work productivity is absolutely hurt by this.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: No light to indicate state of Caps Lock
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard suffers from one nagging limitation. There is no light to indicate the state of the Caps Lock! That is extremely annoying. There is a momentary indicator on screen when you change the state of the Caps Lock, but it really gets old having to press the Caps Lock key to display the state of that setting. The keyboard is well made and has a good basic design. It could use a greater "U" angle for the key alignment as the very shallow angle currently in use is almost like a straight-line keyboard. I would have given this keyboard 5 stars except for those two deficiencies.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Fine when it works
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of this keyboard, and the fact that it's lightweight, easy to hold in one's lap while typing. I've only had it a few months, so can't comment on durability. When it works, it's fine. Sometimes, however, the keystrokes just don't register or one has to type very slowly to make it work. I've tried moving the USB to differently situated ports on my desktop, but it still happens from time to time. This may be an issue specific to my desktop or the way I hold the keyboard in my lap, but given that issue, I would not recommend buying it nor would I buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: William R Swindaman

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The old keyboard finally gave out. I decided to try an ergonomic keyboard for the first time. I am glad I did. The keyboard was easy to set up and after about a week of getting used to the shape, I am able to type even faster than before. The shape is much more natural for hand placement. The keyboard has feet at the head that raise the top of the keyboard if that is better for you. It is for me. I also like that this is a full keyboard with a 10 key number pad. With the number pad, typing numbers is so much faster. Great keyboard for the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Well designed keyboard that works great
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of using a laptop keyboard. Wanted a full size keyboard with number pad and other keyed features. This Logitech keyboard works very well for my purposes. So far, the battery has lasted a long time. Pretty good since I use it daily for work. The keyboard fits my hands well. I like the extra buttons for things such as volume controls. Definitely makes it easier than finding the volume control on the laptop or on screen. The wrist pad is pretty comfortable too. No fatigue with all day use.
customer_reviews.author: droid fan

customer_reviews.title: Large but comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: My second one of these. The first one was highly worn and I had spilled coffee in it a time or two. It can be disassembled and cleaned, if you're handy. I used it for work for a number of years before some of the keys got balky and I bought a different one on impulse. I'm happy to have this one again, as the slight angle of the keys is more comfortable than the straight ones. The wrist rest is reasonably soft without being thick and spongy. Works well with the Logitech software where you can assign functions to keys if you wish.
customer_reviews.author: FactsDontMatter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I saw this at Walmart, but didn't like the package deal with the mouse. Looked on Amazon :) and found it here with only the keyboard, so it was cheaper. I'm still figuring it out, but it fits well and the hotkeys are great. I do wish there was more direction on how to set up the programmable keys, but I'm sure there out there online. Only other thing is I don't like the way the key strike sounds. I am hoping that changes with time. For the price, this is a no- brainer compared to mechanical keyboards that can costs hundreds.
customer_reviews.author: The General

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Ergonomic Keyboard with Nice Key Action
customer_reviews.text: In my Work From Home office, I needed an ergonomic keyboard similar to the ergonomic keyboard that I had at work. This keyboard was priced well and I was very pleased that the keys had an almost mechanical key press feel to them. The action of the keys is very nice. The only downside is that the keys are louder than the cheap membrane keyboard keys. I also like the padded palm rest on this keyboard. I may replace my work keyboard with this keyboard in the future. I would definitely recommend this keyboard to others.
customer_reviews.author: sandm

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this keyboard at least 3 times. (keep reading) Since it was released. I have one for both computers and it's by far my favorite keyboard. It's never died on me, but after 3 years the keys have some fading on them. Keep in mind, my work is typing. I type over 300wpm, 7 hrs a day. If you are looking for a good typing keyboard that will keep your hands from cramping, this is the keyboard for you.
customer_reviews.author: Echoscape

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my expensive Microsoft sculpt died -- or rather, the tiny USB fob was slightly bumped and rendered the entire set useless. The Logitech is really comfortable on my wrists -- definitely compares to the sculpt. I like the way the keys sink in, though there could be a bit more curve to it to replicate the natural position of my wrists. Keys are a little noisy but feel hefty and responsive. The wrist rest is well place, but coffee spills get into the tiny holes. Not really portable, like the sculpt, but a good option. And the fob is really tiny and barely sticks out from my laptop usb port.
customer_reviews.author: Calamity Jane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this keyboard. I needed a keyboard to put on my lap while in my recliner. This keyboard fits across my lap perfectly and it stays in place. It is heavy so it doesn't move around. It is really solid and sturdy. I just love it. It has some cool features, like push the music button and my windows media player opened to all my music. I didn't even have to do any set up for this to happen. It is ergonomic, so my hands are not twisted like they were on my old keyboard. I would buy it again. It has no lag.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Wills

customer_reviews.title: Loud keys, feels cheap, needed software
customer_reviews.text: You'll drive everyone around you crazy with how loud these buttons are. The buttons feel super cheap too. It works fine and there are lots of great button tools on here. Great functionality, but you have to install SetPoint from their website for some of these to work? Why? If you have the zoom tool on the keyboard then why wouldn't the drivers for the board support that? Returning it and going back to Microsoft board.
customer_reviews.author: Anacott

customer_reviews.title: Two week review
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard for over two weeks now and it's been great for my wrist. An issue I had previously with ergonomic keyboards was the size, as they tend to be taller then a normal keyboard, but this one has a pretty slim profile. I don't find myself using the shortcut keys very often, but I have plans to program them to be part of my basic workflow. Overall a quality keyboard at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Potwin

customer_reviews.title: what could have been
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all with the horrible functionality. Design and aesthetics are great.....but this thing is intermittent that typing a paper is extremely painful. It stops working....not in a consistent way (if that even exists). I bought 2 of them and can only send back 1. Logitech used to be great....but their wireless leaves me looking for a wired keyboard at this point.
customer_reviews.author: l

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't satisfy the need.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless ergonomic keyboard to replace the corded Microsoft one that I had. I was very disappointed in the quality of the product and feel of the keyboard...very noisy and felt like it wouldn't last very long. And the position of the keys was not even close to what I had with the Microsoft ergonomic keyboard, which I went back to using. Logitech make many excellent products but this was not one of them. It was returned for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight M.

customer_reviews.title: Great value at $36.99
customer_reviews.text: Managed to nick this when on discount at $36.99 If at regular price of 59.99, I wouldn't have bought it. The traditional group of 6 buttons above the arrow keys, got re-org'ed into 5 buttons in this version. Very counter-intuitive for folks who are used to location of home/end/insert/delete/pg up/down without looking. On this keyboard version, I keep mis-hitting vs where I remembered things were. So yeah, took some getting used to. But, at $36.99, fine. I'm sure I'll get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great but did not last
customer_reviews.text: I love the shape and functionality of the keyboard, but sadly it only lasted 7 months. I type a lot for my job and 7 months after purchase it started double typing, spacing where I didn't space and skipping letters. The batteries are fresh so that is not the issue. Also, the white on the keys have worn off on several letters. I know it was not an expensive item, but I expected it to last more than 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Archangel Art Studio

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well-made wirelesss keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Logitech wireless keyboards are generally well-made, have excellent battery life, and are extremely easy to use. This one is no exception. The only issue to be aware of is that wireless RF keyboards are prone to hacking...others can purchase devices that can take over or interfere with the Logitech RF receivers. Not very useful unless someone has physical access to the system the keyboard is connected to, but something to be aware of nonetheless. Otherwise the keys have a quick response rate and the keyboard works reliably when it's fairly far away from its receiver. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisWNY

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and wireless
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Logitech with my multiple laptop computers for years (probably over a decade). This is my favorite one by far. It really does work if you spend hours on your computer. My laptops last much longer because I literally would destroy the keyboard prior to anything else wearing out on the laptop. Plus frankly, the keyboards on laptops are NOT comfortable to use if you have arthritis or carpel tunnel! I just bought the 2nd one for my spouses computer because I thought I had probably absconded with the one he got as a gift for his birthday:)
customer_reviews.author: Kona

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a black mark on Logitech's reputation
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! This keyboard worked well for a couple weeks. Soon thereafter it became slow: the keyboard could not keep up with my typing and invariably lost characters along the way (very annoying when entering passwords, as you can imagine). The keyboard also had issues waking from sleep mode; it usually took several minutes to begin accepting keystrokes and rarely accepted them all (as above). I read the reviews before I purchased but had a hard time believing Logitech would allow such a crappy device to by produced and distributed. Save your money or you too will find you've wasted $40 (or whatever the current price is).
customer_reviews.author: Wordlance

customer_reviews.title: Keys Stop Working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for 3 months, and several of the keys have stopped working. It's impossible to use. (I'm typing this from a different computer.) Contacted their chat support, and was told it was a hardware problem, and to return it under warranty. But. We couldn't find a serial number printed anywhere on it. There is no serial listed on the Amazon receipt, and I threw out the box about a month ago. My bad, I guess. Anyway, it seems you can't initiate the warranty process without a serial. So apparently I'm out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: H. McClure

customer_reviews.title: Big and Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's really big. The reason it seems so big is because it has that wave palm rest attached and the last row where the space bar is, the buttons are quite large. In all honesty if Logitech was going to go with a palm rest then they should have went bigger. I'm 5'11" and my palms barely fit on it for as large as it looks. My hands actually slide off of the palm rest because it is tilted downward. Logitech should widen the palm rest about another 1" and level it out so it's not tilted down. So all-in-all this keyboard suks.
customer_reviews.author: Slow-N- Low

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for over a month, I was hesitate to buy a wireless keyboard thought I was going to have connection issues or some type of mess to deal with. With this keyboard I turn it off everyday after work and use rechargeable batteries seems to work for weeks before needing to change the batteries. Connected easily, honestly no problems. Worth the buy for working 8 hours a day. Comfortable the keys are soft don’t have to push my finger down, love that I can put it anywhere without the wires in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these July of 2019. It worked great for several months. Then I spilled on it and several keys stuck, no matter how many times I cleaned it. So, I replaced it with a new one less than 2 months ago. Over the past several days, the function has quickly deteriorated. First, there were keystroke lags, then almost no "signal" at all apparently. I replaced the batteries, but the problem has only gotten worse. Waste of money that has severely impacted my ability to work for several days. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use these everywhere I type and have a desktop keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these keyboards for years now, and I really like them. I have never been a big fan of the Microsoft ergo ones, as they are too far off a regular keyboard which makes going back and forth to a laptop one annoying for me. The key action may not be for everyone, but I guess I've gotten used to if for the most part. Only complaint is that if you loose the dongle or need to use the software to repair/consolidate to one dongle you have to download and use Logitech's app which is really hard to do when you don't have a working keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: MichaelJ

customer_reviews.title: Connection problems/Skipped letters
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this keyboard. I works but only "sort of". When typing, keystrokes will randomly not register (are skipped), forcing one to backtrack and retype the letter. Previously, I had a wired version of this keyboard, and it was great. Apparently the wired version is no longer available. This wireless version is a disappointment. I'm going back to a wired keyboard by another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: soil doc

customer_reviews.title: I may have received a bad keyboard....
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible, I have to restart it / reconnect it multiple times a day, it lags when I'm typing and I wind up with gibberish and extra letters and no spaces. I've reinstalled everything, changed batteries, restarted; honestly, I don't haime to deeaall with the headache thhiis keyoard is cauing (this last sentence waas an example of how the lag screwws up the typing). I expected more from Logitech as everything else I've used from them has been functional and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Kara S

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up wirelessly. It seems so solid and just the right weight so it doesn't feel flimsy. I also like the fact that I can use the stands on the bottom to make the keyboard stand higher. I don't like flat keyboards. I just go it a few days ago so I don't know how all the features work, but I have used the volume buttons and they work well. I recommend this keyboard. I also like the feel of the material the keyboard is made of. It doesn't feel plastic.
customer_reviews.author: G Stevens

customer_reviews.title: familiar keyboard I have used for years, but much less experience
customer_reviews.text: I use this to replace one I spilled soda on... had used for years. I can't type on my laptop- touch typist, and keeps getting errors or shutting off--- this is like the old one I have used for a long time, and solves the issues. I have carpal tunnel syndrome, and this is really a help as well. I am retired from an large insurance company, and had my manager pass these out to our nurses to avoid workers comp claims and it worked. I have no idea why other keyboards are not done this way. Only thing I would change is- light up the keyboard for use at night. I am glad to have it back.
customer_reviews.author: a cameron

customer_reviews.title: Really help with wrist and finger strain!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard!! Connected right away to my computer with ease using the wireless dongle that comes with it. The wave of the keyboard really gives a great position for hand placement. It has reduce the strain on my wrist and fingers. Great product and great price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Average keyboard but very loud
customer_reviews.text: Standard ergo keyboard. I like the dedicated buttons for things like calculator, mail, etc. However my two main issues were: 1) can’t seem to type as fast on this vs. other keyboards. 2) it’s LOUD. I’m in conference calls a lot and everyone can hear me type. I jokingly call it my 80’s typewriter Pros: it’s a Logitech and seems to be built well. It works with the same Logitech USB receiver that my mouse uses so that’s convenient. Ultimately I’m buying a different keyboard and giving this one to my dad. He needs an ergo keyboard and I need something quieter.
customer_reviews.author: O. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for about 2 months now and use it a lot almost every day (approx. 50 hours/wk). Battery life is good so far. I LOVE the customizable buttons and how easy they were to set up. The keyboard functions are very handy. I find if very comfortable to type and the wrist rest is also very comfortable. The shape of the keyboard seems to be ergonimacly correct. I think the buttons are loud when typing, that is not an issue for me, but I think it's worth mentioning in case it matters for someone else. It's practically impossible to type quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy B

customer_reviews.title: Stops typing on and off on and off.
customer_reviews.text: I had the wired version of this keyboard for 13 years. I loved it! When my wired keyboard died I purchased this wireless version of my first keyboard because for whatever reason Logitech stopped making the wired version. This keyboard is very annoying in the fact that it just stops typing all of a sudden and it's on and off on and off. Very irritating to my nerves. I sadly would not recommend this keyboard. I shall trash this $40 piece of junk and ordered Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U), not ergonomic but could not find one to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to work reliably...
customer_reviews.text: The lay out is very nice and the dedicated keys are a big plus. I've just not been able to get it to stay connected to my laptop/docking station (I have a Lenovo laptop with a docking station) and the Logitech Support was to issue me a trouble ticket and then not hear from them. Had to revert to an earlier Logitech model that I liked so much that I've worn the paint off some of the more used letters. Thank goodness I'm the primary user and touch type (faded letters not such an issue)
customer_reviews.author: UC Frank

customer_reviews.title: Best large and comfortable keyboard around!
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard for a heavy daily typist with comfort and large layout of keys. One thing I really appreciate is that the INSERT key is set above and away from the BACK key because I type transcripts daily and on most other keyboards, when I use the BACK key, I somehow hit the INSERT key and typing goes into OVERTYPE mode, which is very annoying. This has never happened with this keyboard. I always keep spares of these keyboards not because of mechanical problems but because I hate that the lettering wears off within months to a year at most.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Bevilacqua

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard is great. I am still getting used to the 'hump' ...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great. I am still getting used to the 'hump' in the middle. As to ergonomics, it is minimal. But that was not my objective; wireless was. That part works without a hitch. All the peripheralbuttons are not important to me. Maybe to a gamer. I can recommend this keyboard. I have an issue with the mouse. It seems to have some sort of hitch in it. It is bothered by a jerky motion. I am making do, but that is the big shortfall. I think it is the wireless on the mouse, and it pairs with the board, and the computer. I think it is too complicated in the pairing part..
customer_reviews.author: JumpDog

customer_reviews.title: Great at first! - Key issues after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Up until recently (4 months after purchase), this keyboard has been fantastic! I really like having all the extra buttons surrounding the main keys, especially the volume ones. HOWEVER, recently I have been having an issue with a couple keys, specifically with making the ( and @ symbol. I can type 2 and 9 with little to no issues and can capitalize letters using shift, but after 4 months the keyboard has been having issues consistenly doing shift+2 and shift +9. The 2 key has been increasingly also failing to work. It sounds like some reviewers the keyboard works wonderfully for a couple years, so I wouldn't outright not recommend it as it was otherwise fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless, 25% of keys do not function.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless. I bought this when I ordered a new laptop since it was Logitech day, laptop was delayed and when it finally arrived my keyboard return window had expired. On very first use Aprox 25% of the keys do not work unless you mash them multiple times (100% is the keyboard as I tested it on two laptops and a PS4). Amazon attempted to contact Logitech for a warranty however I then received an email passing the information to me, and as of yet have been unable to get anyone to help me. Sounded great however 100% waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about the size of this keyboard as i don't have much desk space but i love it!! It's comfortable to use, has a built in wrist rest and multiple options for height so you can find what works best for you, or change as needed. Have not tried all the extras but so far so good. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: RLL

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality. Deep, Deep Key Travel
customer_reviews.text: Works reliably and well. My one criticism is the key travel is too deep for my tastes. It is like the keyboards from the early days of computing. That doesn't make it bad, just not what I want. Having worked with laptops as my primary computer for more than 15 years, I'm most comfortable with the short travel of those keyboards. So, I like an external keyboard with similar travel. Truly, I didn't realize it until I bought this keyboard. The difference is so great that it was quickly noticeable. That said, the ergonomics work well. The wrist cushion is comfortable. The overall quality is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Chehalin

customer_reviews.title: Curved finger position is great
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has raised keys. There is only one windows key and it is on the left hand. the larger keys are nice, they make you type a little slower but I seem to be more accurate with them that is why I gave it 5 starts. The zoom button on the left does not work out of the box, nor does the camera button but I can program those in. Calculator button does work. I really like the feel of this keyboard. I do not game on it nor do I put my computer to sleep with it.
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Good ergo for under $50
customer_reviews.text: My wife occasionally has wrist pain, so we wanted to get a nice ergo keyboard that she could use without breaking the bank. The keyboard is very comfortable and she enjoys typing again. There are definitely plenty of buttons on there so you can control things such as volume and so forth with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: No Lights for CAPS on/off
customer_reviews.text: It’s bulky for sure. I do like it for its ergonomic style but it doesn’t have any buttons that light up to let you know if CAPS are on. I work from home so that’s issue for me when I have to enter passwords. I’m looking for another keyboard with the lights for caps on. You really don’t think it’s a big deal but apparently it is.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard everyday at work, never been dropped or spilled upon....4 mos later, certain keys stopped working. I changed the batteries but still no improvement. Where's the craftsmanship?! I'm so tired of buying expensive crap with crappy warranties! Looks like I've gotten the bad end of the deal yet again.
customer_reviews.author: L L.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've given Logitech 3 chances to impress me over the past 20-ish years, and every time it was a fail. Everything they make is just so cheaply made. I mean I've had better quality from a well known chinese site I'm sure you know. Don't get this; at the very least the letters will rub off the keys quickly within a few months among other things. It looks nice, it should be nice, but once again looks are deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Benton Broken

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it is working.
customer_reviews.text: When it has a good connection it works great. Unfortunately sometimes when you wake it up, it just doesn't really reconnect well, so there is a huge lag between when you type and when it goes through. If I unplug the dongle and then plug it back in, it starts working great again, but it's kind of a pain when you never know if your keyboard is going to work or are you going to have to go reset it.
customer_reviews.author: Kweebia

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great! I love the tall buttons so i chose this one. It works great but ive had it since October and the buttons already are fading. Which I do use this all day at work but I feel just too soon...other than that it is a good keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: lushsliz

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I've never had an issue with Logitech so I didn't take out the insurance. First the backspace key, then the numbers, and finally the whole key board started acting up. I changed out the batteries twice. I guess I got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Key touch
customer_reviews.text: I strongly dislike this keyboard specifically because none of the other features matter if you can't type on it. The key touch is extremely deep, which makes it very difficult to use if you want to type quickly. Besides that, it it noisy every time you hit a key, and has a cheap feel to it when you are using it. Despite the comfortable ergonomic features, I cannot use this keyboard and will return it. I am just going to resume using my older wireless Microsoft keyboard, which does not have ergonomic features, but nonetheless is preferred by my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Magus

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's not an extreme departure from normal keyboards I've used, but I favor one that has some heft. This one is light weight but feels solid. The keys make little sound when typing. They are at a slightly rounded position from the normal straight keyboard. I have not programmed all the extra keys so their use is to be determined. I like most the hand heel rest which is soft and well placed. The only negative is the on-off switch is on the bottom and is pretty small. I sure would like to be able to program a top key to power on-off.
customer_reviews.author: RonK

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for three weeks.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd update: Still not working reliably. Frequent pauses, skips, double types. I can't recommend this keyboard. Update: I tried yet another set of batteries, and it's working fine for the moment. I hope it lasts because I do like the shape and feel of the keyboard. Worked great for about 3 weeks then started skipping letters, delaying typing. Changing batteries did nothing. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Eveleth

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for big handed people, Writers, and Gamers.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for about a month now and I love it. I upgraded from Logitech Wireless Illuminated Keyboard K800, Computer Keyboard Wireless to this. Not only does this keyboard fit my hands more, but it also suits my needs. I do gaming online with my computer and it makes for a good gaming keyboard as well as a writing keyboard. For some reason, The Illuminated Keyboard is more expensive and I'm not sure why? Only gave it 4 stars bc it doesn't recharge like the other keyboard I had. It does fairly decent on battery life and it does come with batteries so that's a plus. I would definitely buy this keyboard recommend it for writers, Gamers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Hall

customer_reviews.title: Stupid to not have Cap Lock and Num lock indicator lights.rs
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have read the reviews before I purchased. HATE not having a Caplock indicator light and to add insult to injury NO num lock indicator either Using! Using it for work and having to sign in to multiple applications requiring user name & password all day without being able to see if Cap Lock is on is a major pain. I wish i could return it, but I recycled the box before I realized it.
customer_reviews.author: Scarletrae

customer_reviews.title: "Deep Dish" shape
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was purchased to replace a series of Microsoft Comfort Curve 2000 keyboards which all seemed to have reliability problems with nonfunctioning keys. I generally like Logitech's products. The Logitech 350 has many of the same "convenience" keys that the 2000 had plus some extras. It has a similar curve as the 2000, but the keyboard has a " deep-dish" feel to it so that there are more collisions when I am trying to type fast. That may fade as I get more accustomed to the different shape. I would not have purchased the Logitech if I had confidence in Microsoft's reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Slack47

customer_reviews.title: Had it since 2011 and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since 2011 and is still currently in use. I play video game and program using this keyboard and its surprisingly comfortable and resistant. I've only ever had one issue and thats that the stands broke, but you can buy them from logitech for like 5 dollars if i remember right, and even then they broke years after I bought this keyboard. I highly recommend this keyboard if you type constantly. The volume, music control keys and quick launch keys are just icing on the cake!
customer_reviews.author: Frank N.

customer_reviews.title: Junk. It disabled my system sounds.
customer_reviews.text: This is not plug and play. I plugged it in and it shut down my speakers and sound entirely. The process for "troubleshooting this (there is not one solution -- it's clearly been a problem but it looks like a few hours of try and fail ahead of me) is not worth the time it will take. It may be nice, but it''s loud and I tend to need system sounds and the ability to hear ...oh...anything. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Heather K

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics are great, no issue there.  However...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the tinny and cheesy-quality sound of the keys while typing. Hubby has this identical keyboard that is several years old, his has NO sound when typing. Quite annoying, as I am a typist by career. Didn't see anything on this in the reviews, or I wouldn't have purchased. If anyone has an idea on how to silence the keys, it would be most appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Colorado Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Large & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is quite large, but very comfortable for someone who works on a computer all day. The keys are a little louder than I am used to, but I am used to laptop keyboards and they are very quiet. Overall I am happy with the quality I am getting for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: A must have keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have three laptops and a k350 for each one! It has everything in a wireless keyboard that I want and I can move it out of the way when not in use. Funny thing about the battery saving sleep mode is I can’t remember ever changing the batteries in over three years!
customer_reviews.author: Scott T. Word

customer_reviews.title: Gone with the wind
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has left me with mixed feelings. Ten years ago, my brain would have seen it as a cheaply made item, but today it comes across as a well made item. Anyway, as far as modern keuboards go, this is really nice. I'm enjoying every 'bit' of it. It is ergonomit, with contours that really aid in fast and intuitive typing. The only thing I'm taking some time getting used to is that the End key is way up in Siberia and the Delete key is like California.. long and narrow
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Decent option
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes great keyboards and accessories. The only thing I don't like about the item is the feel of the space bar due to the engraved "WAVE" name. It's nice having all the extra shortcut buttons to quickly link to apps without having to use Windows search or shortcuts to get to them. I like that I can also pair this up to my Xbox for use when gaming as well. While the keys are not straight lined like a standard keyboard, they aren't quite as angled as a standard ergo board so it took a day or so to get used to the hand placement and speed of typing to be restored.
customer_reviews.author: Erika M

customer_reviews.title: keys stop working, this keyboard is garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a few months. It seemed fine at first but now the switches (rubber domes) on a few keys are nonfunctional. The backspace key, some number keys and arrow keys simply don't work. It's impossible to type without spelling errors. I blew the dust out to make sure it wasn't just some dirt lodged in it, but it just doesn't work. Garbage quality.
customer_reviews.author: edstirling

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard at a great value. Before purchasing the only review that worried me was in regards to the letters coming off of the keyboard. I don't see a sign of that happening at all. Keyboard is light weight, quiet and has a lot of bells and whistles, more than I know what to do with. I use this keyboard at work and I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wagmaister

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard will lag out and intermittently not work.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard constantly “lags”. While typing, it will stop registering on the screen. Then all at once half the letters you typed will type out. The only solution is to turn the keyboard off and on a few times until it fixes itself. I unfortunately waited too long and cant return mine. I dumped it in the trash and wasted $30.
customer_reviews.author: Cordell Hoffer

customer_reviews.title: Don't last waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The numbers & letters are coming off & keys are sticking. I have only had it for less than a year. Have to get a different keyboard. If you want one for work use DO NOT GET THIS ONE lasted less than a year. If you just want one for home use it may last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to purchase a second time.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Wave wireless keyboard. My 1st Wave finally gave up after several years of heavy use/abuse. (Pounding is good for them, right?) No amount of cleaning could unstick a few of the keys. So here we go again. Hope they don’t stop making this style. After dual carpel tunnel surgeries, it’s the only keyboard I can comfortably use for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Prudently Zaney

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I order this item about month and half ago but never came, so i give it another try again and this time is came and i am glad i re order it. Easy control and a very light way, just plug and go. The only thing i don't like on K350 is when i hit Cap is no light on to tell me i am on Cap mode. I am a Logitech fans and i got everything under Logitech, i trust this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa T

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I have used in years
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I have used in years. Comfortable. Sized for your hands, convenient and useful buttons. I wish that they had included are indicator lights for the Caps- and Number-Lock keys. (They do provide an on-screen alert when you do hit the key, but the notification needs be more permanent. I also wish that they had include a function that would allow reassignment of some of their function keys. The Music and Media Center keys both bring up Grove...neither of which I use or have any interest in using.
customer_reviews.author: The Owlbg ng esbmnegbvggvvmesgbenegbeesesnfvvs.envnnfh nw.esvg🎸🎸:-*:-|:-:-P:-:-P(TT)(TT):-D:O:-D

customer_reviews.title: Logitech says it all for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Logitech computer accessories for many, many years now and have never been disappointed with any purchase. This keyboard was purchased to replace a very old Logitech keyboard that needed to be retired. And I am very happy with it. It does exactly what it is supposed to. The keys are easy to use. The arm rest is a helpful addition. It is Logitech! A name I have always purchased and trusted and will continue to as long as they continue to make such excellent products at such reasonable prices! Very, very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: danyitoo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. They had this at my desk when I started my new job in August. I love that one so much I ordered this one for home. Easy on the wrists, lots of comfort when resting. The extra keys are awesome, I can pull up the calculator without having to hunt it down or reach for the mouse, I can control all my sounds, movies, pages open and more! I also find the on/off option great for when I am not using it as much, or when my kids are around. I don't have to worry about keys being hit accidenatly or the batteries running down.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Summars

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I work in a fast-paced sitting office environment and use it every day. The battery is great, I got used to the switch quickly and the size is perfect. I've used many different Logitech keyboards and other brands, this is by far my favorite! Toyed around with the wireless rang one day and it's unbelievable. For standard office work, it definitely covers everything and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: cr in kentucky

product_meta.title: Logitech K350 Wireless Wave Keyboard with Unifying Wireless Technology - Black
product_meta.description: With its distinctive Wave design and Constant Curve layout, Logitech Wireless Keyboard K350 guides your hands into just the right position and conforms naturally to your fingers. Plus, the cushioned palm rest helps position hands comfortably and properly on the keyboard. Together, they can help you type with ease and confidence, but without forcing you to re-learn typing on an unfamiliar layout. And your keyboard is always ready when you need it. Thanks to its long battery life (up to three years*), fast and reliable wireless, and the tiny receiver you can plug once and forget, wireless hassles are a thing of the past.
feature_bullets: Wave design with Constant Curve layout: Curved layout guides hands into just the right position
Ease and comfort: Cushioned palm rest makes work easier and fun more fun

Longer battery time: This feature gives you up to three years of battery life. (Battery life based on a calculation of an estimated 2 million keystrokes per year in an office environment. User experience may vary.)

Logitech Unifying receiver: The tiny Unifying receiver stays in your notebook, so there's no need to unplug it when you move around. And you can easily add compatible wireless mice and keyboards to the same wireless receiver

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,133 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
